ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Respondent
Notes: NA=Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Do you / Does your child have unusual behaviors during sleep, such as walking, talking, kicking, punching, eating or screaming?
Notes: 0 = Not during the past month; 1 = 1-3 times per month; 2 = Once or twice a week; 3 = Three or more times a week

ElementDescription: Unusual behaviors during sleep - How much does this sleep problem bother you / your child?
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Slightly; 2 = Moderately; 3 = Very much; 4 = Extremely

ElementDescription: Unusual behaviors during sleep - How much does this sleep problem cause you / your child difficulty in getting along with others, getting things done at home/work/school, or other important areas of your / your child's functioning?
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Slightly; 2 = Moderately; 3 = Very much; 4 = Extremely

ElementDescription: Do you / Does your child have an irresistible urge to move your / their legs, or uncomfortable feelings in your / their legs, especially in the evening hours or when trying to be still?
Notes: 0 = Not during the past month; 1 = 1-3 times per month; 2 = Once or twice a week; 3 = Three or more times a week

ElementDescription: Urge to move legs - How much does this sleep problem bother you / your child?
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Slightly; 2 = Moderately; 3 = Very much; 4 = Extremely

ElementDescription: Urge to move legs - How much does this sleep problem cause you / your child difficulty in getting along with others, getting things done at home/work/school, or other important areas of your / your child's functioning?
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Slightly; 2 = Moderately; 3 = Very much; 4 = Extremely

ElementDescription: Do you / Does your child have loud snoring, frequent snoring, gasping, or pauses in your / their breath while you / they are sleeping?
Notes: 0 = Not during the past month; 1 = 1-3 times per month; 2 = Once or twice a week; 3 = Three or more times a week

ElementDescription: Snoring/Apnea - How much does this sleep problem bother you / your child?

ElementDescription: Snoring/Apnea - How much does this sleep problem cause you / your child difficulty in getting along with others, getting things done at home/work/school, or other important areas of your / your child's functioning?
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Slightly; 2 = Moderately; 3 = Very much; 4 = Extremely

ElementDescription: Do you / Does your child have difficulty falling asleep?

Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Slightly; 2 = Moderately; 3 = Very much; 4 = Extremely

ElementDescription: Difficulty falling asleep - How much does this sleep problem cause you / your child difficulty in getting along with others, getting things done at home/work/school, or other important areas of your / your child's functioning?
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Slightly; 2 = Moderately; 3 = Very much; 4 = Extremely

ElementDescription: Do you / Does your child have difficulty staying asleep, or getting back to sleep after an awakening?
Notes: 0 = Not during the past month; 1 = 1-3 times per month; 2 = Once or twice a week; 3 = Three or more times a week

ElementDescription: Difficulty staying asleep - How much does this sleep problem bother you / your child?
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Slightly; 2 = Moderately; 3 = Very much; 4 = Extremely

ElementDescription: Difficulty staying asleep - How much does this sleep problem cause you / your child difficulty in getting along with others, getting things done at home/work/school, or other important areas of your / your child's functioning?

ElementDescription: Are your / your child's sleep hours much earlier, much later, or much more irregular than most other people's? That is, are your / your child's sleep hours ''out of sync'' with the requirements of your / their work, school, or other schedule obligations?
Notes: 0 = Not during the past month; 1 = 1-3 times per month; 2 = Once or twice a week; 3 = Three or more times a week

ElementDescription: Odd sleep hours - How much does this sleep problem bother you / your child?
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = Slightly; 2 = Moderately; 3 = Very much; 4 = Extremely
